means: 辩论，争论
就…进行争论，辩论
对…的真实或有效进行争论，怀疑
争夺，竞争
抵抗，抵制

（劳资）纠纷
罢工

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"辩论，争论，说理"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: argue, quarrel, debate, dispute, discuss, reason
means: argue ：指提出理由或证据为自己或自己一方的看法或立场辩护，着重说理、论证和企图说服。
quarrel ：指两人之间或两个团体之间不友好的、吵吵嚷嚷地大声争论某事，尤指"吵嘴、吵架"。
debate ：侧重指意见等对立的双方之间正式或公开的争辩。
dispute ：侧重对分歧进行激烈或热烈的争论或争辩，带一定感情色彩，常隐含"各持已见"或"争论不休"意味。
discuss ：最常用词，指就某一或某些问题表明观点、看法等，以便统一认识，解决问题。
reason ：指据理力争以说服对方或求得对问题作更深入的研究。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这组名词均有"争执，不和"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: controversy, argument, conflict, debate, dispute, quarrel, strife
means: controversy ： 侧重指深刻的意见分歧，多指对引起广泛兴趣或非常重要的问题的辨论。
argument ： 指辩论双方均以事实或理由来说服对方的辨论。
conflict ： 指双方坚持已见、互不妥协，怀有敌意的争论，多暗示分歧极为严重，有时用语言无法解决，只得诉诸武力。
debate ： 通常指经过仔细组织和计划的个人或团体之间的辩论。
dispute ： 普通用词，侧重指长时间，言词激烈，针锋相对的争辩。
quarrel ： 普通用词，既可指言词激烈的争吵，也可指温和的言词上的不和。
strife ： 指因不可缓和的矛盾而引起的争吵或斗殴。

sentence.Network_en: The council recently drew fire for its intervention in the dispute.
sentence.Network_cn: 委员会最近因为介入该起争端而遭到批评。

sentence.Network_en: There are few goodies and baddies in this industrial dispute.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这次劳资纠纷中几乎没有绝对的好人与坏人。

sentence.Network_en: They agreed to try to settle their dispute by negotiation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们同意通过谈判来努力解决纠纷。

list.abs: 英语词汇的奥秘 ... attendant 出席者 disputant 争论者 confidant 信任者，知已.

this paper tries to explicit current arbitration scope applying to the occupation sport disputes so as to set up and perfect the mechanism fors solving occupation sport dispute .旨在通过明确现行仲裁范围在职业体育纠纷的具体适用，建立健全我国职业体育纠纷的解决机制。
and to act as mediator , not too many disputes ., 尽量充当和事佬 , 就没有太多纷争.

lj.lj_ly: the main part of his argument was beyond dispute.
lj.lj_ls: 他的观点的主要部分是毋庸置疑的。

lj.lj_ly: such estimates are always open to dispute.
lj.lj_ls: 这样的推测总是不确定的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin disputare 'to estimate' (in late Latin 'to dispute'), from dis- 'apart' + putare 'reckon'

entry.def: A dispute is an argument or disagreement between people or groups.

example.ex: They have won previous pay disputes with the government...
example.tran: 在先前和政府的工资纠纷中他们赢了。

example.ex: Negotiators failed to resolve the bitter dispute between the European Community and the United States over cutting subsides to farmers.
example.tran: 谈判者未能消弭欧共体和美国之间在削减农民补贴一事上的争端。

entry.tran: 质疑(事实、声明或理论)；对…表示异议
entry.def: If you dispute a fact, statement, or theory, you say that it is incorrect or untrue.

example.ex: Nobody disputed that Davey was clever...
example.tran: 没有人怀疑戴维是聪明的。

entry.def: When people dispute something, they fight for control or ownership of it. You can also say that one group of people dispute something with another group.

example.ex: Russia and Ukraine have been disputing the ownership of the fleet...
example.tran: 俄罗斯和乌克兰一直在争夺舰队的所有权。

example.ex: Fishermen from Bristol disputed fishing rights with the Danes.
example.tran: 布里斯托尔的渔民与丹麦人争夺捕鱼权。

entry.def: If two or more people or groups are in dispute, they are arguing or disagreeing about something.

example.ex: The two countries are in dispute over the boundaries of their coastal waters...
example.tran: 两国在近海水域分界线上尚存分歧。

example.ex: It is currently in dispute with the government over price fixing.
example.tran: 目前在定价上和政府还有争议。

entry.def: If something is in dispute, people are questioning it or arguing about it.

example.ex: All those matters are in dispute and it is not for me to decide them.
example.tran: 所有这些事项都尚无定论，也不是我可以决定的。

means.word_mean: 1. a disagreement or argument about something important;

sentences.sentence: "he had a dispute with his wife"
"the familiar conflict between Republicans and Democrats"
"We quarreled over the question as to who discovered America"
"These tewo fellows are always scrapping over something"

Sentence.sentence: There is, in our view, no real dispute here, we are all seeking the same thing, which is schools that better serve our children and our nation by encouraging students to tackle tough subjects under the guidance of gifted teachers.
They want to protect themselves against medical disputes.
Disputes were characterized by intense verbal ( 言语上的) aggression, tended to be repeated and not resolved and made men, more than women, extremely angry.
Reasons for this ranged from inheritance disputes to hostility between spouses.
More than half of them were involved in inheritance disputes
A labor dispute at a bus company.

sentences.en: Some husbands and wives are always disputing.

sentences.cn: 咱们来讨论一下这个决定吧。

sentences.en: They disputed how to get the best results.
sentences.cn: 他们讨论如何获得最佳结果。

sentences.en: They were disputing whether they should start at once.
sentences.cn: 他们在讨论是否应立即开始。

means.word_mean: 怀疑…的真实性或妥当性

sentences.en: I disputed the minister's figures, the true cost of the project is much higher.
sentences.cn: 我怀疑部长所说的数字; 那个项目的实际花费要高得多。

sentences.en: I don't dispute that children need love.
sentences.cn: 我对于儿童需要爱并无异议。

means.word_mean: 就…进行辩论，就…发生争论，争论，辩论，讨论(问题)

sentences.en: The issue was hotly disputed in the committee.
sentences.cn: 委员会对这个问题进行了激烈辩论。

means.word_mean: 为争夺(土地、阵地、胜利等)而战

sentences.en: The two sides continued to dispute the ownership of the territory.
sentences.cn: 双方继续争夺那片领土的所有权。

sentences.en: We disputed an advance of the enemy troops.

means.word_mean: 辩论, 争端, 争执

sentences.en: We had a dispute about how much money he owed me.
sentences.cn: 我们就他欠我多少钱一事进行了一番争论。

sentences.en: John got into a dispute with Jack about the money.
sentences.cn: 约翰与杰克为了钱的事吵了起来。

means.word_mean: 激烈争辩，争执，争吵，吵架

sentences.en: The school board members spend their time disputing and getting nothing done.
sentences.cn: 学校董事们争论不休，但一事无成。

jushi.english: Some husbands and wives are always disputing.

jushi.chinese: 他们正在热烈地讨论着。
